intro: Chondrosea brevicaulis, commonly known as the short-stemmed sea holly, is a marine plant found in coastal regions. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its compact, succulent growth habit. The plant features small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are usually fleshy and adapted to retain moisture in salty environments. Chondrosea brevicaulis plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for small marine organisms.
